alert.note: Alert for Coke; Sterling (Texas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS San Angelo (Central Texas San Angelo)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued May 26 at 8:59PM CDT by NWS San Angelo
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of southwestern Coke and northeastern Sterling Counties through 945 PM CDT... At 858 PM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm 9 miles north of Sterling City, moving southeast at 25 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and half inch hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Robert Lee, E.V. Spence Reservoir Near Paint Creek Recreation Area and The Intersection Of Highway 158 And Ranch Road 2059. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.50 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building.
